subject: Re: [junit] Which parameter in my list failed?
msgSnippet: David, Why not output the .toString() of the parameters? This is how TestNG does it: @DataProvider(name = A ) protected Object[][] dp(ITestContext tc) {
messageBody:
David,

Why not output the .toString() of the parameters?

This is how TestNG does it:

@DataProvider(name = "A")
protected Object[][] dp(ITestContext tc) {
return new Object[][] {
{ "Cedric", 20 },
{ "David", 21 },
};
}

@Test(dataProvider = "A")
public void testA(String s, int n) {
}

Output:

PASSED: testA("Cedric", 20)
PASSED: testA("David", 21)

===============================================
Priority
Tests run: 2, Failures: 0, Skips: 0
===============================================

This makes it trivial to diagnose a failed data-driven test.

--
Cédric


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
